observed. We can then test the theory by seeing whether these predictions
hold true. For example, we can make spheres out of a wide variety of mate-
rials, calculate their densities, and then see which ones float. If any sphere
floats that is denser than water, then we have to give up our principle that a
sphere floats in water only ifit is less dense than water. (This is an applica-
tion of the necessary condition test, discussed in Chapter 9.) If we find a
